articles.author: Steven Scheer, Steve Holland, Parisa Hafezi
articles.description: Iran and Israel launched new missile strikes at each other on Wednesday as the air war between the two longtime enemies entered a sixth day despite a call from U.S. President Donald Trump for Iran's unconditional surrender.
articles.title: Israel-Iran air war enters sixth day, Trump calls for Iran's 'unconditional surrender'

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: India Prime Minister Narendra Modi told U.S. President Donald Trump that India would never accept third-party mediation in its conflict with Pakistan, India's Foreign Secretary Vikram Misri said on Wednesday.
articles.title: India will not accept third-party mediation of relations with Pakistan, Modi tells Trump

articles.author: David Ljunggren, John Irish, Andreas Rinke
articles.description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy will on Tuesday urge the Group of Seven to provide more backing for the war against Russia even after U.S. President Donald Trump left the summit early due to developments in the Middle East.
articles.title: Ukraine's Zelenskiy to seek G7 support as Trump's early exit puts dampener on summit

articles.author: Tim Kelly
articles.description: Japanese premier Shigeru Ishiba's bid to get U.S. President Donald Trump to relax tariffs imperiling his country's economy and his political future fell flat this week, underlining the gulf between the allies as more levies are set to kick in.
articles.title: Japan's Ishiba departs G7 with US trade deal and political future in doubt

articles.author: Gram Slattery, Humeyra Pamuk
articles.description: A senior Trump administration official is planning to travel to Belarus in the coming days to meet the country's president, according to four sources briefed on the matter, as ceasefire talks between Ukraine and Russia remain deadlocked.
articles.title: Exclusive: Trump's Ukraine envoy to meet Belarus' Lukashenko, sources say

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Flights took off for Israel on Wednesday from Cyprus, airport sources and web flight tracking sites showed, ferrying home Israelis stranded abroad during the conflict with Iran.
articles.title: Repatriation flights start for Israelis stranded in Cyprus

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Indonesian police have arrested three Australian men for a shooting incident that killed a fourth at a villa on the resort island of Bali, its police chief said on Wednesday.
articles.title: Indonesian police arrest three Australian men over shooting in Bali

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Former President Jair Bolsonaro's son and allies have been formally accused by Brazilian federal police after a probe into the alleged surveillance of authorities by spy agency ABIN during Bolsonaro's time in office, a police source and local media said.
articles.title: Bolsonaro's son and allies accused in Brazil spy agency case, source says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Several flights to the Indonesian resort island of Bali were cancelled or delayed and the airport in Maumere in East Nusa Tenggara province was closed due to the eruption of Mount Lewotobi Laki-laki, officials said on Wednesday.
articles.title: Many flights to Indonesia's Bali cancelled after volcano eruption

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi, Dawoud Abu Alkas
articles.description: Israeli tanks fired into a crowd trying to get aid from trucks in the Gaza Strip, killing at least 51 people, according to medics, in one of the bloodiest incidents yet in mounting violence as desperate residents struggle for food.
articles.title: Israeli tank fire kills 51 people in Gaza crowd trying to get food
